00039 /**
00040 * @file timemodel.h
00041 * @date 2008/04/23 16:38

00046 * @brief %Time handling (header)

00052 #include "stdint.h"

00059 /** Time represented in the maximal internal time resolution
00060  * (eg. Nanoseconds, but it could be milliseconds). The
00061  * Macros SECONDS, MILLISECONDS, etc correspond to this unit
00062  *
00063  * **************** WARNING:  Dpereacted, use int64_t
00064  */
00065 
00066 typedef int64_t TTime; ///< WARNING: DEPRECATED, use int64_t
00067 
00068 /** this implementation: nanoseconds about 150 Years from now */
00069 #define END_OF_TIME   0x7FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFLL
00070 
00071 // Example of usage: waitFor(3*SECONDS); int64_t t0 = 10*HOURS;
00072 #define NANOSECONDS    1LL
00073 #define MICROSECONDS   (1000LL * NANOSECONDS)
00074 #define MILLISECONDS   (1000LL * MICROSECONDS)
00075 #define SECONDS        (1000LL * MILLISECONDS)
00076 #define MINUTES        (60LL * SECONDS)
00077 #define HOURS          (60LL * MINUTES)
00078 #define DAYS           (24LL * HOURS)
00079 #define WEEKS          (7LL  * DAYS)
00080 
00081 /**
00082 * @class TimeModel
00083 * @brief %Time conversion/transformation functions
00084 *
00085 * TimeModel interface, Stores a time value.
00086 * Prefer to use the global object
00087 * "Time sysTime"
00088 * instead of creating your own Time object,
00089 * but you may if you need your independent time model.
00090 *
00091 * The clock model class holds the parameters of a linear clock model
00092 * that relates UTC to the Primary OnBoard Time (t).
00093 * UTC = utcDeltaTime + localTime + drift*(localTime - tSync)
00094 * Here utcDeltaTime = UTC - localTime is determined from the
00095 * difference of the UTC time and the Primary OnBoard Time at
00096 * an instance t = tSync.
00097 * In the absence of a drift error, utcDeltaTime matches the
00098 * actual value of UTC at the  start of the onboard clock.
00099 * i.e. at t=0. The drift value
00100 * (dUTC/dt)-1 measures the fractional rate error of the onboard clock.
00101 *               -- (c) Oliver Montenbruck (DLR GSOC)
00102 *
00103 */
00104 class TimeModel {
00105 
00106 private:
00107     /* diff local time from UTC time: > 0 UTC is future of local time */
00108     int64_t utcDeltaTime;
00109 
00110     /* The local time value at time of tSync */
00111     int64_t tSync;
00112 
00113     /*  Fractional rate error (dUTC/dt) - 1 */
00114     double drift;
00115 
00116 public:
00117 
00118     int32_t leapSeconds; ///< leapseconds since 2000, 2011 aprox 15, used to get gpsTime
00119 
00120     TimeModel();
00121 
00122     /** current time in nanoseconds,
00123      * DEPRECATED! do not use, use the macro NOW()
00124      **/
00125     static int64_t getNanoseconds();
00126 
00127     /* using UTC and local time */
00128 
00129     /** Sets the offset and reference epoch of the clock model */
00130     void setClockOffset(const int64_t utcDelta, const int64_t tSync);
00131 
00132     /** like setClockOffset. */
00133     void setUTC(const int64_t time);
00134 
00135 
00136     /** tdelta  > 0 if date > 1.1.2000 */
00137     void setUTCDeltaTime(const int64_t tDelta);
00138 
00139     /** diff from local time to UTC (>0 if after year 2000)  */
00140     int64_t getUTCDeltaTime();
00141 
00142     /** based on most recent clock model */
00143     int64_t getUTC();
00144 
00145     /** UTC2, or gpsTime: UTC without leapseconds (we add leapseconds!) **/
00146     int64_t getGpsTime() {  return getUTC() + (int64_t)leapSeconds*SECONDS; }
00147 
00148     /** Sets the UTC drift parameter of the clock model */
00149     void setDrift(const double drift);
00150 
00151     /** Increments or decrements utcDeltaTime */
00152     void correctUTCDelta(const int64_t deltaDelta);
00153 
00154     /** Converts the given local time to the corresponding UTC time. */
00155     int64_t localTime2UTC(const int64_t loaclTime);
00156 
00157     /** Converts the given UTC time to the corresponding local time. */
00158     int64_t UTC2LocalTime(const int64_t utc);
00159 
00160 
00161     /**
00162     * computes time units (eg nanoseconds) from 1.January 2000 to given date
00163     * (=MJD 51544) (c) Oliver Montenbruck (DLR GSOC).
00164     * All computations are valid from 1901 March 1.0 to 2100 Feb. 28. <p>
00165     *  References:
00166     * van Flandern T.C., Pulkinnen K.F.; Low-Precision Formulae for
00167     *  Planetary Positions; Astrophys. Journ. Suppl. vol. 41, pp. 391 (1979)
00168     */
00169     static int64_t calendar2LocalTime(int32_t year,
00170                                       int32_t month,
00171                                       int32_t day,
00172                                       int32_t hour,
00173                                       int32_t min,
00174                                       double sec);
00175 
00176     /** converts localTime units since 1. jan 2000 to calendar date and time. */
00177     static void localTime2Calendar(const int64_t localTime,
00178                                    int32_t& year,
00179                                    int32_t& month,
00180                                    int32_t& day,
00181                                    int32_t& hour,
00182                                    int32_t& min,
00183                                    double& sec);
00184     
00185     /** converts localTime units since 1. jan 2000 to modified julian date. */
00186     static double localTime2mjd_UTC(const int64_t &localTime);
00187 
00188     /** calculates the modified julian date (UTC) from a calendar date. */
00189     static double calendar2mjd_UTC( const uint16_t &year,
00190                                   const uint8_t &month,
00191                                   const uint8_t &day,
00192                                   const uint8_t &hour,
00193                                   const uint8_t &minute,
00194                                   const double &second );
00195 
00196     /** calculates the calendar date from modified julian date (UTC). */
00197     static void mjd_UTC2calendar( const double &MJD_UTC,
00198                                uint16_t &year,
00199                                uint8_t &month,
00200                                uint8_t &day,
00201                                uint8_t &hour,
00202                                uint8_t &minute,
00203                                double &second );
00204 
00205     /** convert modified julian date in UTC format to modified julian date in UT1 format. */
00206     static double mjd_UT1fromUTC( const double &MJD_UTC, const double &UT1_UTC );
00207 
00208     /** convert modified julian date in UT1 format to modified julian date in TT format. */
00209     static double mjd_TTfromUT1( const double &MJD_UT1, const double &UT1_UTC, const double &UTC_TAI );
00210 
00211     /** assuming a periodic beat with an offet from 0, computes when shall be
00212     * the next beat
00213     */
00214     static int64_t computeNextBeat(const int64_t begin,
00215                                    const int64_t period,
00216                                    const int64_t timeNow);
00217 
00218 
00219     /**
00220      * Split the local time representation (nanoseconds or milliseconds counter)
00221      * in the ECSS / CCSDS (CUC) time representation standard:
00222      * 32 bit containing the seconds (as an integer counter)
00223      * 32 bit containing the faction of seconds in following format
00224      * most significant bit 1/2 seconds, then 1/4, then 1/8, then 1/16 ...
00225      * until 1/(2^32) seconds.
00226      * Warning: This format allows only positive time values.
00227      */
00228     static void splitTimeECSS(int64_t localTime, uint32_t &seconds, uint32_t &fraction);
00229 
00230 
00231     /// CCSDS CUC time format to local time format
00232     static int64_t  ECSSTimeToLocalTime(uint32_t seconds, uint32_t fraction) {
00233         return (SECONDS * seconds) + ((SECONDS * fraction) / (64*1024)); // 64K is 16 bits fraction
00234     }
00235 
00236 };
00237 
00238 /** A global time object */
00239 extern TimeModel sysTime;
00240 
00241 /**
00242  * returns the time now in the internal time resolution (eg. Nanoseconds).
00243  * This function is redundant to Time::getTime(), but
00244  * this so so often required/used than it deserves a shortcut.
00245  */
00246 
00247 #define NOW() TimeModel::getNanoseconds()
00248 
00249 
00250 /// Time NOW() in seconds as double
00251 #define SECONDS_NOW() ((double)TimeModel::getNanoseconds() / (double)SECONDS)
00252 
00253 
00254 #ifndef NO_RODOS_NAMESPACE
00255 }
00256 #endif
